meanings.definition: A person or thing that cripples.
meanings.sent1: The crippler in the story was the evil wizard who cast a spell on the hero.
meanings.sent2: The police officer was seen as a crippler of crime in the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous gnome played the role of the crippler by hiding everyone's shoes.
meanings.sent4: Fear can be a crippler, holding us back from reaching our full potential.
meanings.sent5: The crippler, a giant boulder, blocked the path of the adventurers.

meanings.sent1: The crippler of his dreams was the accident that left him unable to walk.
meanings.sent2: The disease acted as a crippler, slowly weakening his body over time.
meanings.sent3: Losing his lucky charm felt like a crippler to his confidence.
meanings.sent4: The financial crisis was a crippler to the company's growth.
meanings.sent5: The storm was a crippler, causing widespread damage to the town.
